instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700  starts to read the SSD's then shuts down.   No H2O found.
threads.message:
It starts the power up cycle.   Powers up 2.5V SSD0  I see thermal activity at U9580  which is normal.  Looks like the T2 is trying to read those chips for a while.
Then it just quits reading and shuts down to 0.01A current draw.    Looks like a load failed.

Thermal imaging does not indicate any shorts or other activity.

There are no shorts to be found anywhere on the LB. (that I could find).
Board is free of H2O and physically looks perfect. 

Looking for a little guidance on this one.

threads.title: 820-01700  starts to read the SSD's then shuts down.   No H2O found.
threads.message:
See what happens in DFU mode.
T2 needs to access its partion to load firmware from SSD.
